Name: Executions Per Generation
Configuration Settings.Description: Specifies the number of model executions per generation. By default this setting is 0, meaning that all executions will be performed in the first generation. Otherwise, executions will be split into batches and desired number of generations, allowing for storing temporary results and resuming at a later point.

Name: Max Executions
Termination Criteria.Description: Indicates the maximum number of executions to perform. By default this setting is 0, meaning that as many executions as samples will be performed.

Name: Theta Count
Internal Settings.Description: Number of variables in the samples to execute.
